author: Mark Ellis
title: Majority of people want 'unfit' Southern Rail and other franchises to be renationalised
text:
News Majority of people want 'unfit' Southern Rail and other franchises to be renationalised The poll comes amid claims strikes, which have caused disruption in the South of England, will spread across the country Share More than half said Southern Railway is unfit to run train services (Photo: PA) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Three in four people want troubled Southern Railway and other rail franchises to be taken back into public ownership, a poll has found. 
More than half said the firm was unfit to run train services as strikes continue to paralyse the South of England this week in the long-running row over driver-only operated trains. 
The poll of 1,026 adults for pressure group We Own It shows strong backing for the Mirror’s campaign to renationalise Britain’s railways. Strikes have caused major travel disruption in the South of England (Photo: PA) 
Boss Cat Hobbs said: “We pay huge sums into our railway yet we can’t have conductors to make trains safer. Read More 
"The government must strip Southern of the franchise and bring it into public ownership.” 
It comes amid claims the strikes will spread across the country. Like us on Facebook
